subject: Programming
title: JavaScript and the Browser
description: A micro-lesson that makes JavaScript and the Browser usable.

hook.text: Brendan Eich built JavaScript in just ten days in May 1995.

buildup.text: Netscape needed a scripting language for web pages. They wanted it fast, not perfect.

discovery.text: JavaScript ran in the browser, letting pages respond to clicks without reloading.

twist.text: Those ten days left quirks so bizarre that 0.1 + 0.2 doesn't equal 0.3 in JavaScript.

climax.text: Despite its flaws, JavaScript became the only language every web browser understands.

punchline.text: Ten days of work now runs the entire web.

quiz.question: How long did it take Brendan Eich to create JavaScript?
